title: so is anything gonna be done for the resolve tree?
body:
since you butchered the veteran scars mastery for tanks and fighters, most of them dont even bother with the tree anymore. they either go into ferocity or cunning.

stregth of the ages is still weak with a gimmick attached that is completely useless by the time you get it.

garens highest winrate mastery build is thunderlords by far with a 10% difference to going into resolve.
http://champion.gg/champion/Garen

this is ridiculous. you made the tree officially aimed at tanks and juggernauts and then just threw a load of masteries in there that are aimed at squishy carries to use for the early game, and even removed one of the few scaling masteries.


please to something really useful with strength of the ages and either replace useless masteries like tough skin and recovery, or buff them, or add more useful ones aimed at resistance and health stackers.

ideally we could use a few masteries that help us against adc in lane.

no, practically never picked means practically never picked.

strength of ages, and bond of stone both have about 1.5% pickrate. even if bond of stone would be picked mainly on tank supports, it should generally get picked a lot more often than this.

if every other game had a support tank on one team, the pickrate should still be around 5%.

and if a lot of junglers would pick strength of ages then the same would go for that keystone.

my main issue however is not even the keystones (except stregth of the ages). its more with the t1 and t2 masteries. a lot of them are actually bad past lvlk 3 and dont scale. the other ones are very specific.

Darius too. Olaf too. And Gnar. And Aatrox, Jax, Irelia, etc.

It's not bad that there is choice available, but it sure is strange to notice that so many melee tanky champs are going so deep into cunning.

I'd recommend League of Graphs, unlike Champ GG they update constantly so the data shown is the last week approximately rather than the first 4 days of the patch.

http://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/masteries/top

While it's not perfect this shows that a lot of top laners are using Grasp of the Undying. Bear in mind though this covers every single top laner, including things like Rumble who should never use Undying.

If you look at some individual champs you can see that Grasp is quite popular on a lot of top laners.

The keystones are fine, the problem is how terrible the lower tiers are.

In T2 there's one good mastery, and it's not actually good unless you have forms of regen in your kit. The problem is that Vet Scars is literally so bad that tanks who logically shouldn't take Runic Armour are running it because the base HP regen it gives is better than Vet Scars.

Tier 2 of resolve is actually painful in how little it does for you if your name isn't Mundo.

We'll be continuing to work on the mastery system throughout the year, both balancing existing masteries and adding new ones (next addition likely being Expose Weakness returning as a tier 1 Ferocity keystone). As far as the resolve tree goes I don't feel it's in a terrible place at present, we're seeing some use of all the tier 3 keystones and a number of champions that are heavy resolve users are in pretty impactful spots power wise. It could certainly do with some more options at the Tier 1 and 2 keystone levels though, particularly since some of the existing options there are a bit too niche. 

Additionally resolve's not going to be the right choice for every tough champion. It should generally be appealing to both tough champs who want to double down on their defense and squishier champs looking to get a bit of defense from somewhere. It's a tree that should be appealing to tanks and juggernauts, but it's not intended to be their 'official' tree, so if some of them feel better served in other trees that's all good.

What else are tanks specifically going to use?

The other trees are garbage for them. Right now if I could sink 30 points into resolve as a tank I would, and that's with resolve having some fairly poor masteries outside of T3. The only masteries from other trees I take are the ones that help me to jungle faster.

Also the change from 4% HP to 45 flat HP was just terrible for tanky champs. Most tanks will have 700 HP at level 1, 4% max HP gives them 28 at this number. The difference at low levels is negligible but at higher levels the mastery is terrible. The change just left non-regen based tanks with nothing at this level.
Any thoughts about GP's ability to use Grasp of the Undying so well in top lane? Would removing his ability to proc it from range be enough to get him out of pick / ban in high elo?
I feel like Resolve Keystones are mostly fine... though the lower masteries really aren't all that great so it is pretty useless going 12 into resolve which does kind of limit things

Every keystone makes you better at fighting champions and does basically nothing aside from that. Strength of the Ages is not a major exception to that - the vast majority of its power budget goes into giving you better survivability in fights. Its use in late game tankiness for team fights is comparable on junglers to Thunderlord's as a damage amp in ganks. SotA is being taken so much on junglers not because it's the only useful keystone on them (not at all the case) but because they're the only champions that can reliably and quickly stack it. If every role could stack it like junglers can then I imagine you'd be seeing it on a *lot* more people. I could envision an almost Thunderlord's-esque monopoly.

People need to stop thinking that junglers don't do anything except... jungle. They fight people too, and keystones make them better at that.
It's almost like a little more thought should've been put into the new mastery tree before the complete removal of the old one.

In the defensive tree you can basically use every stat it gives you. And imo thats a good trait.
